channel.title: Lightweight Linux client?
channel.description: Hello, I havvve recently switched back to linux on one computerrrr [it some times repeats keys like that] and am looking for a light weight linux internet client, not firefox. Does anyone have any suggestions?

[/quote]
Kazehakaze*[/quote]

Yeah, that. What a bitch of a name

item.title: Lightweight Linux client?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

What do you mean?
It can do everything you need it for - programming/management/data/spread sheets/documents/internet/games/fun etc etc etc.

item.title: Lightweight Linux client?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:186567”][quote author=cooper link=topic=249031.msg2091187#msg2091187 date=1204795412]

My keys did that once, and before I could figure out why I restarted and it magically stopped, annoying isn’t it?

Konqueror is really nice in my opinion, seamonkey is supposed to be nice and more lightweight as well.

Thanks that worked I also 4x’d my ram, made it MUCH faster and better.
Yeah, konqueror is my favorite, but I cannot figure out how to switch the middle mouse button to open a new tab. Also the scroll feature doesn’t work

Swiftfox is a nice optimised Firefox, so you get better performance with an already known interface.

That sounds good, I will try it tomorrow when I can get back on linux. By the way, does anyone know a good way to load linux without a cd drive? My computer is perfect for it [although probably some features wouldn’t work] yet it does not have a cd drive.
[/quote]

Scroll and middle mouse button work perfectly in Firefox using Kubuntu, but not in Konqueror like you said, although there is surely a way to set it up I have just not bothered with it as of yet. I’m sure you could google an answer or ask in the IRC channel.

You could install linux from a USB flash drive I suppose, or with a floppy and a network connection.[/quote]
USB… I never thought of that, thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Lightweight Linux client?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:6, topic:186567”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=249031.msg2089926#msg2089926 date=1204761362]
My keys did that once, and before I could figure out why I restarted and it magically stopped, annoying isn’t it?

Konqueror is really nice in my opinion, seamonkey is supposed to be nice and more lightweight as well.
[/quote]
Thanks that worked I also 4x’d my ram, made it MUCH faster and better.
Yeah, konqueror is my favorite, but I cannot figure out how to switch the middle mouse button to open a new tab. Also the scroll feature doesn’t work

Swiftfox is a nice optimised Firefox, so you get better performance with an already known interface.

That sounds good, I will try it tomorrow when I can get back on linux. By the way, does anyone know a good way to load linux without a cd drive? My computer is perfect for it [although probably some features wouldn’t work] yet it does not have a cd drive.[/quote]

Scroll and middle mouse button work perfectly in Firefox using Kubuntu, but not in Konqueror like you said, although there is surely a way to set it up I have just not bothered with it as of yet. I’m sure you could google an answer or ask in the IRC channel.

You could install linux from a USB flash drive I suppose, or with a floppy and a network connection.

Read full topic

Konqueror is really nice in my opinion, seamonkey is supposed to be nice and more lightweight as well.
[/quote]
Thanks that worked I also 4x’d my ram, made it MUCH faster and better.
Yeah, konqueror is my favorite, but I cannot figure out how to switch the middle mouse button to open a new tab. Also the scroll feature doesn’t work :([/quote]

I think the shortcuts are to do with the system, middle mouse button never worked as tab for me when I was trying kubuntu.

item.title: Lightweight Linux client?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:186567”]My keys did that once, and before I could figure out why I restarted and it magically stopped, annoying isn’t it?

Konqueror is really nice in my opinion, seamonkey is supposed to be nice and more lightweight as well.[/quote]
Thanks that worked I also 4x’d my ram, made it MUCH faster and better.
Yeah, konqueror is my favorite, but I cannot figure out how to switch the middle mouse button to open a new tab. Also the scroll feature doesn’t work

Greeny:

Swiftfox is a nice optimised Firefox, so you get better performance with an already known interface.

That sounds good, I will try it tomorrow when I can get back on linux. By the way, does anyone know a good way to load linux without a cd drive? My computer is perfect for it [although probably some features wouldn’t work] yet it does not have a cd drive.

Read full topic
